properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 4:35PM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the
following rivers in Mississippi...

Pearl River At Jackson affecting Hinds and Rankin Counties

The Flood Warning continues for
The Pearl River At Jackson.
* until further notice.
* At  3:30 PM Tuesday the stage was 32.2 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 28.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 33.5 feet Friday
evening.
* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.3 feet
on Apr 6 2017.
* Impact...At 33.0 feet...Rosemary Road is closed. Sidney Street is
impassable. Water covers West Street. The playing field off
Westbrook Road is underwater. Water is on Nichols and Julienne
streets in the Hightower Area; however, both are passable. Water is
approaching Packs Auto Detail shop on South West Street.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 24 hours.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.

NWSheadline: Forecast flooding increased from Minor to Moderate severity
